page.title: 02Population
page.content: The area is sparsely populated, having a total of 147 persons (5 children under 5 years, 31 of school age, 94 of working age and 17 over 60 years). Occupation of residents: In an area where the chief employment was once in farming & mining, there is now a wide variety of occupations; most people commuting by car to their place of work. There are 16 farmers, also teachers, social workers, builders, restauranteurs, physiotherapists, a probation officer, doctor, architect librarian, health visitor, hairdresser insurance broker, agricultural salesman, retired dentist, car salesman and a potter. Some retired farmers earn a living by grass-letting their land for summer grazing. Many professional families live in former farmhouses, the land having been sold off to enlarge existing units.
